tit.cmt: termsのつづりミス、またここでは銅鐸自体の記事なので（）補足は省き、単に"dotaku"と表記していきます。

sen.j: 銅鐸（どうたく）とは、弥生時代に製造された釣鐘型の青銅器のこと。
sen.e: Dotaku are hanging bell-shaped bronze wares produced during the Yayoi period.
Dotaku are hanging bell-shaped bronze wares produced during the Yayoi period.
Dotaku are hanging bell-shaped bronze wares produced during the Yayoi period.

sen.j: 銅鐸は、紀元前2世紀から2世紀の約400年間にわたって作り用いられた祭器である。
sen.e: Dotaku are ritual utensils produced and used over about 400 years, between the second century B.C. and the second century.
Dotaku are ritual utensils produced and used over about 400 years, between the second century B.C. and the second century.
Dotaku are ritual utensils produced and used over about 400 years, between the second century B.C. and the second century.

sen.j: これまでに出土した銅鐸は全国で約500個である。
sen.e: About 500 dotaku have ever been excavated all over Japan.
About 500 dotaku have ever been excavated all over Japan.
About 500 dotaku have ever been excavated all over Japan.

sen.j: 主な出土数は以下の通り（平成13年3月末 文化庁調べ）
sen.e: The number of dotaku excavated in the main prefectures are shown as below. (According to the research by the Agency for Cultural Affairs as of the end of March, 2001).
The number of dotaku excavated in the main prefectures are shown as below. (According to the research by the Agency for Cultural Affairs as of the end of March, 2001).
The number of dotaku excavated in the main prefectures are shown as below (According to the research by the Agency for Cultural Affairs as of the end of March, 2001).
sen.cmt: 句読点を変更しました。

sen.j: 兵庫県 56点
sen.e: Hyogo Prefecture: 56
Hyogo Prefecture: 56
Hyogo Prefecture: 56

sen.j: 島根県 54点
sen.e: Shimane Prefecture: 54
Shimane Prefecture: 54
Shimane Prefecture: 54

sen.j: 徳島県 42点
sen.e: Tokushima Prefecture: 42
Tokushima Prefecture: 42
Tokushima Prefecture: 42

sen.j: 滋賀県 41点
sen.e: Shiga Prefecture: 41
Shiga Prefecture: 41
Shiga Prefecture: 41

sen.j: 和歌山県 41点
sen.e: Wakayama Prefecture: 41
Wakayama Prefecture: 41
Wakayama Prefecture: 41

sen.j: 大きさについては12センチから1メートルを越すものまである。
sen.e: The size ranges from 12 centimeters to more than 1 meter.
sen.cmt: 長さの表記は アラビア数字+meters (centimeters)のかたちで統一します。
sen.e: The size ranges from 12 centimeters to more than 1 meter.
The size ranges from 12 centimeters to more than 1 meter.

sen.j: 1世紀頃には高さが60センチに達し、さらに大型化が進み、2世紀には1メートルを超え、最終的には134センチに達する。
sen.e: Around the first century, dotaku with 60 centimeters in height were started to be produced and, still keeping getting bigger, they exceeded 1 meter in the second century and then finally reached 134 centimeters.

Around the first century, dotaku with 60 centimeters in height were started to be produced and, further getting bigger, they exceeded 1 meter in the second century and then finally reached 134 centimeters.
sen.cmt: still keepingをfurtherに変更しました。
sen.e: Around the first century, dotaku with 60 centimeters in height were started to be produced and, further getting bigger, they exceeded 1 meter in the second century and then finally reached 134 centimeters.

sen.j: しかし、その直後鋳造が止んでいる。
sen.e: Soon after this, however, the production of dotaku was stopped.
sen.cmt: 「鋳造」: ここでは「製造」と解釈しています。
sen.e: Soon after this; however, the production of dotaku was stopped.
sen.cmt: howeverの前のコンマをセミコロンにしました。
sen.e: Soon after this; however, the production of dotaku was stopped.

sen.j: 現存する最大は、144センチ、45キログラムに達する（滋賀県野洲市野洲町大岩山1881年出土1号銅鐸）。
sen.e: The biggest in existence is 144 centimeters in height and 45 kilograms in weight (No. 1 dotaku excavated in Mt. Oiwa in Yasu Cho, Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture in 1881).
sen.cmt: 重さの表記は アラビア数字+kilogramsのかたちで統一します。
sen.e: The biggest in existence is 144 centimeters in height and 45 kilograms in weight (No. 1 dotaku excavated in Mt. Oiwa in Yasu Cho, Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture in 1881).
The biggest in existence is 144 centimeters in height and 45 kilograms in weight (No. 1 dotaku excavated in Mt. Oiwa in Yasu Cho, Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture in 1881).

sen.j: 近畿地方で生産されたものは表面に必ず文様がつけられている。
sen.e: All dotaku produced in Kinki region have patterns on the surface.
All dotaku produced in Kinki region have patterns on the surface.
All dotaku produced in Kinki region have patterns on the surface.

sen.j: 文様で一番多いのが、袈裟襷文（けさだすきもん）で、縦の文様帯と横の文様帯とを交差させている。
sen.e: The most popular pattern is the Buddhist stole-like pattern, where lateral pattern lines and horizontal pattern lines cross each other.
sen.cmt: 「袈裟襷文」: Buddhist stole-like patternとします。
sen.e: The most popular pattern is the Buddhist stole-like pattern, where lateral pattern lines and horizontal pattern lines cross each other.
The most popular pattern is the Buddhist stole-like pattern, where lateral pattern lines and horizontal pattern lines cross each other.

sen.j: その前は流水文であった。
sen.e: Before it, the running water-like pattern was popular.
Before it, the running water-like pattern was popular.
Before it, the running water-like pattern was popular.

sen.j: 最古級の銅鐸は、縦文様帯と横文様帯を持つ四区袈裟襷文で飾っている。
sen.e: The oldest dotaku are decorated with the four-section Buddhist stole-like pattern with vertical pattern lines and horizontal pattern lines.
sen.cmt: 「四区袈裟襷文」: four-section Buddhist stole-like pattern
sen.e: The oldest dotaku are decorated with the four-section Buddhist stole-like pattern with vertical pattern lines and horizontal pattern lines.
The oldest dotaku are decorated with the four-section Buddhist stole-like pattern with vertical pattern lines and horizontal pattern lines.

sen.j: また、吊り下げる鈕の断面形が菱形となっている（菱環鈕式りょうかんちゅうしき）。
sen.e: Also, they have a crown with a lozenge cross-section (lozenged crown type).
sen.cmt: 「紐」: crown （参考URL: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell_(instrument))「菱環鈕式」: lozenged crown type
sen.e: Also, they have a crown with a lozenge cross-section (lozenged crown type).
Also, they have a crown with a lozenge cross-section (lozenged crown type).

sen.j: しかし、大阪府東奈良遺跡から出土した小銅鐸の鈕の断面形が円形である。
sen.e: However, small dotaku excavated in the Higashinara Ruins in Osaka Prefecture have a crown with a round cross-section.
However, small dotaku excavated in the Higashinara Ruins in Osaka Prefecture have a crown with a round cross-section.
However, small dotaku excavated in the Higashinara Ruins in Osaka Prefecture have a crown with a round cross-section.

sen.j: その後、外縁付鈕式、扁平鈕式、突線鈕式と変遷する。
sen.e: After the lozenge type, the crown shape underwent a transition: the outer-edged type, the flat type and then the raised-line type.
sen.cmt: 「外縁付鈕式」: outer-edged type「扁平鈕式」: flat type「突線鈕式」: raised-line type
sen.e: After the lozenge type, the crown shape underwent a transition: the outer-edged type, the flat type and then the raised-line type.
After the lozenge type, the crown shape underwent a transition: the outer-edged type, the flat type and then the raised-line type.

sen.j: その後鐸自身が大型化し、表面に飾りが加わる。
sen.e: And from later on dotaku itself grew in size with a decoration added on the surface.
And from later on dotaku itself grew in size with a decoration added on the surface.
And from later on dotaku itself grew in size with a decoration added on the surface.

sen.j: 紀元前2世紀後半頃40センチを超す大型銅鐸が現れ、流水文が採用されている。
sen.e: Big dotaku exceeding 40 centimeters with the running water-type patterns appeared in the late second century B.C.
Big dotaku exceeding 40 centimeters with the running water-type patterns appeared in the late second century B.C.
Big dotaku exceeding 40 centimeters with the running water-type patterns appeared in the late second century B.C.

sen.j: この文様は紀元前1世紀頃に衰退する。
sen.e: This pattern declined in the first century B.C.
This pattern declined in the first century B.C.
This pattern declined in the first century B.C.

sen.j: 当時の家屋など弥生時代の習俗の様子を描いた原始的な絵画が鋳出されているものもある。
sen.e: Some dotaku feature primitive paintings representing manners and customs of that time such as houses.
Some dotaku feature primitive paintings representing manners and customs of the Yayoi period such as houses.
sen.cmt: 原文に忠実に弥生時代をthe Yayoi periodに変更しました。
sen.e: Some dotaku feature primitive paintings representing manners and customs of the Yayoi period such as houses.

sen.j: 中国の銅鈴が起源とされるが、日本で出土する形状に類似するものは見つかっていない。
sen.e: Dotaku is said to have originated from Chinese copper bells but no similar shape has been found in Japan.
Dotaku is said to have originated from Chinese copper bells but no similar shape has been found in Japan.
Dotaku is said to have originated from Chinese copper bells but no similar shape has been found in Japan.

sen.j: また、朝鮮半島には、朝鮮銅鐸と言われる文字も絵もない小型のものが出土する。
sen.e: In the Korean Peninsula, small bells without any letters and paintings, which are called "Korean dotaku," have been discovered.
In the Korean Peninsula, small bells without any letters and paintings, which are called Korean dotaku, have been discovered.
sen.cmt: クォーテションマークを削除しました。
sen.e: In the Korean Peninsula, small bells without any letters and paintings, which are called Korean dotaku, have been discovered.

sen.j: それらの影響は考えられるが、その後日本の銅鐸は日本で独自に発達した。
sen.e: Japanese dotaku can probably have been affected by these bells, but they developed individually after being brought to Japan.
sen.cmt: 「その後」: 「日本に持ち込まれた後」と意味を補足しています。
sen.e: Japanese dotaku can probably have been affected by these bells, but they developed individually after being brought to Japan.
Japanese dotaku can probably have been affected by these bells, but they developed individually after being brought to Japan.

sen.j: 1世紀末ごろを境にして急に大型化する。
sen.e: Dotaku got bigger and bigger prominently from the end of the first century.
Dotaku got bigger and bigger prominently from the end of the first century.
Dotaku got bigger and bigger prominently from the end of the first century.

sen.j: この大型化した銅鐸には、近畿式と三遠式の二種がある。
sen.e: These bigger dotaku have two types: the Kinki type and the Sanen type.
These bigger dotaku have two types: the Kinki type and the Sanen type.
These bigger dotaku have two types: the Kinki type and the Sanen type.

sen.j: 近畿式は大和・河内・摂津で生産され、三遠式は濃尾平野で生産されたものであろうと推定されている。
sen.e: It is thought that the Kinki type was produced in Yamato, Kawachi and Settsu Province while the Sanen type was made in the Nobi Plain.
sen.cmt: 「大和」「河内」「摂津」: これらが地域名であることを明示するため「国」を付け足します。
sen.e: It is thought that the Kinki type was produced in Yamato, Kawachi and Settsu Province while the Sanen type was made in the Nobi Plain.
It is thought that the Kinki type was produced in Yamato, Kawachi and Settsu Province while the Sanen type was made in the Nobi Plain.

sen.j: 近畿式は、近畿一帯を中心として、東は遠江、西は四国東半、北は山陰地域に、三遠式は、東は信濃・遠江、西は濃尾平野を一応の限界とし、例外的に伊勢湾東部・琵琶湖東岸・京都府北部の日本海岸にそれぞれ分布する。
sen.e: The Kinki type dotaku have been found mainly in the whole Kinki region, from Totomi Province in the east to the eastern half of Shikoku in the west and to Sanin region in the north, and the Sanen type ones are located mainly in the area from Shinano and Totomi Province in the east and the Nobi Plain in the west, and exceptionally in the eastern coast of Ise Bay, the eastern shore of Lake Biwa, and the coast of the Japan Sea in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

The Kinki type dotaku have been found mainly in the whole Kinki region, from Totomi Province in the east to the eastern half of Shikoku in the west and to Sanin region in the north, and the Sanen type ones are located mainly in the area from Shinano and Totomi Province in the east and the Nobi Plain in the west, and exceptionally in the eastern coast of Ise Bay, the eastern shore of Lake Biwa, and the coast of the Japan Sea in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

The Kinki type dotaku have been found mainly in the whole Kinki region, from Totomi Province in the east to the eastern half of Shikoku in the west and to Sanin region in the north, and the Sanen type ones are located mainly in the area from Shinano and Totomi Province in the east and the Nobi Plain in the west, and exceptionally in the eastern coast of Ise Bay, the eastern shore of Lake Biwa, and the coast of the Japan Sea in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: それぞれの銅鐸は2世紀代に盛んに創られた。
sen.e: For both types, many were produced in the second century.
For both types, many were produced in the second century.
For both types, many were produced in the second century.

sen.j: 2世紀末葉になると近畿式のみとなる。
sen.e: In the end of the second century, only Kinki type dotaku were produced.
In the end of the second century, only Kinki type dotaku were produced.
In the end of the second century, only Kinki type dotaku were produced.

sen.j: 銅鐸はさらに大型化するが、3世紀になると突然造られなくなる。
sen.e: After this, dotaku still got bigger but disappeared in the third century.
After this, dotaku still got bigger but disappeared in the third century.
After this, dotaku still got bigger but disappeared in the third century.

sen.j: 銅鐸が発見された記録は、『扶桑略記』の天智天皇7年、近江国志賀郡に崇福寺を建立するのに際して発見された記述が最古であろうという。
sen.e: The record of discovery of dotaku can possibly track back to the description in "Fuso Ryakki" (A Brief History of Japan) saying it was found during the construction of Sofuku-ji Temple in Shiga District in Omi Province in the seventh year of Emperor Tenchi's reign.

The record of discovery of dotaku can possibly track back to the description in "Fuso Ryakki" (A Brief History of Japan) saying it was found during the construction of Sofuku-ji Temple in Shiga District in Omi Province in the seventh year of Emperor Tenchi's reign.

The record of discovery of dotaku can possibly track back to the description in "Fuso Ryakki" (A Brief History of Japan) saying it was found during the construction of Sofuku-ji Temple in Shiga District in Omi Province in the seventh year of Emperor Tenchi's reign.

sen.j: ただし、天智期の記事を詳細に記しているはずの記紀は、この出来事について全く触れていない。
sen.e: However, the details of this discovery were not described at all in both "Kojiki" (Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which should have included the detailed history in the Tenchi era.

However, the details of this discovery were not described at all in both "Kojiki" (Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which should have included the detailed history in the Tenchi era.

However, the details of this discovery were not described at all in both "Kojiki" (Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which should have included the detailed history in the Tenchi era.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』には、和銅6年、大和宇波郷のひとが長岡野において発見した記事があり、『日本記略』には、弘仁12年、播磨国で掘り出され、「阿育王塔鐸」とよばれたとある。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) says that a dotaku was found in Nagaokano by one from 宇波 Village in Yamato Province in 713 and "Nihon Kiryaku" (Outlines of the Annals of Japan) states a dotaku was excavated and called "Totaku of Ashoka the Great" in Harima Province in 821.
sen.cmt: 「宇波」: 読み方不明。「うなみ」か「うば」か不明瞭です。『日本記略』: "Nihon Kiryaku" (Outlines of the Annals of Japan) としました。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) says that a dotaku was found in Nagaokano by one from 宇波 Village in Yamato Province in 713 and "Nihon Kiryaku" (Outlines of the Annals of Japan) states a dotaku was excavated and called "Totaku of Ashoka the Great" in Harima Province in 821.

"Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) says that a dotaku was found in Nagaokano by one from 宇波 Village in Yamato Province in 713 and "Nihon Kiryaku" (Outlines of the Annals of Japan) states a dotaku was excavated and called "Totaku of Ashoka the Great" in Harima Province in 821.

sen.j: 現在のところ用途は未だ定かではないが、出土状況や表面に遺された痕跡などから使用方法はある程度明らかにされている。
sen.e: The purpose is uncertain at the moment but how they were used has been revealed to some extent from excavated states and marks on the surface.
The purpose is uncertain at the moment but how they were used has been revealed to some extent from excavated states and marks on the surface.
The purpose is uncertain at the moment but how they were used has been revealed to some extent from excavated states and marks on the surface.

sen.j: 銅鐸はその形状ゆえ、初期の小型の物は鈕の内側に紐などを通して吊るし、舞上面に開けられた穴から木や石、鹿角製の「舌（ぜつ）」を垂らして胴体部分か、あるいは「舌」そのものを揺らし、内部で胴体部分の内面突帯と接触させる事で鳴らされたと考えられる（西洋の鐘と同じ）。
sen.e: From the shape, it is thought that early small dotaku had a string or others hanging from a crown and a tongue (clapper) made of wood, stone or a deer horn dangling inside the body through the top hole, and that it was rung when the tongue touches a raised-area on the inside wall of the body by swinging the body or the tongue itself (same mechanism as in Western bells).

From the shape, it is thought that early small dotaku had a string or others hanging from a crown and a 'tongue (clapper)' made of wood, stone or a deer horn dangling inside the body through the top hole, and that it was rung when the tongue touches a raised-area on the inside wall of the body by swinging the body or the 'tongue' itself (same mechanism as in Western bells).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテションマークをつけました。
sen.e: From the shape, it is thought that early small dotaku had a string or others hanging from a crown and a 'tongue (clapper)' made of wood, stone or a deer horn dangling inside the body through the top hole, and that it was rung when the tongue touches a raised-area on the inside wall of the body by swinging the body or the 'tongue' itself (same mechanism as in Western bells).

sen.j: これは鈕の下部及び側面に紐で長期間吊るされた事による「擦れ」と考えられる痕跡や、内部の突帯に舌が当たった為にできたと思われる凹みの形での損傷が確認される銅鐸があるためであり、梵鐘のように胴体部の外面を叩く事でできたと考えられる痕跡のある物はないため、そのように鳴らしたような再現図は誤りである。
sen.e: This can be guessed because some dotaku have marks of "abrasion" on lower and side areas of the crown due to prolonged use for hanging a string, or marks of damage (dent) on the inside raised-area due to contact of the tongue, and therefore, a reproduced image of dotaku where they are rung by hitting the outer surface of the body like Buddhist temple bells is wrong because no such marks are found.

This can be guessed because some dotaku have marks of 'abrasion'on lower and side areas of the crown due to prolonged use for hanging a string, or marks of damage (dent) on the inside raised-area due to contact of the tongue, and therefore, a reproduced image of dotaku where they are rung by hitting the outer surface of the body like Buddhist temple bells is wrong because no such marks are found.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: This can be guessed because some dotaku have marks of 'abrasion'on lower and side areas of the crown due to prolonged use for hanging a string, or marks of damage (dent) on the inside raised-area due to contact of the tongue, and therefore, a reproduced image of dotaku where they are rung by hitting the outer surface of the body like Buddhist temple bells is wrong because no such marks are found.

sen.j: なお、銅鐸を「鳴らす」段階にあってはこの内面突帯の摩滅を軽減するため、この内面突帯を二本に増やした物が銅鐸の発達と共に増えていく。
sen.e: To reduce abrasion on the inner raised-area, two-line type was produced while dotaku were developing during the stage of the "ringing" function.
To reduce abrasion on the inner raised-area, two-line type was produced while dotaku were developing during the stage of the 'ringing' function.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。内面突帯を二本に増やした物をtwo-line typeと訳されていますが、英文を読んだだけでは、lineが内面突帯であることが明確に伝わってこないように思います。
sen.e: Since creating a rising, belt-like pattern inside a dotaku reduced the abrasion caused when it was rung, the use of two lines forming rising patterns became an increasingly common style as development of the dotaku continued.

sen.j: 1世紀末頃には大型化が進み、鈕が薄手の装飾的な物への変化が見られることから、（後述のように異論はあるが、）音を出して「聞く」目的から地面か祭殿の床に置かれて「見せる」目的へと変化したのではないかと言われている。
sen.e: At the end of the first century, when dotaku grew in size, the crown was changed to something more decorative and thinner, which possibly means the purpose was changed from "hearing" a sound to "exhibiting" them on the ground or floors of shrines. (There is another theory described as below, though.)

At the end of the first century, when dotaku grew in size, the crown was changed to something more decorative and thinner, which possibly means the purpose was changed from "hearing" a sound to "exhibiting" them on the ground or floors of shrines. (There is another theory described as below, though.)

At the end of the first century, when dotaku grew in size, the crown was changed to something more decorative and thinner, which possibly means the purpose was changed from "hearing" a sound to "exhibiting" them on the ground or floors of shrines (there is another theory described as below, though).

sen.j: これは「聞く銅鐸」から「見る銅鐸」への展開と呼ばれ（田中琢）、鈕・鰭外部に耳が付くことが多くなる。
sen.e: This is called a transition from "dotaku to hear" to "dotaku to see" (Taku TANAKA), and many of the latter one have "ear"(round or half-round ornament) on the edge of the crown and the fin (decorative plate along the body side).
sen.cmt: 「…ことが多くなる」: 左のように「後者の多くは…である」と意訳しています。「鰭」「耳」: 直訳し、（）内で補足説明とかたちにしました。
sen.e: This is called a transition from 'dotaku to hear' to'dotaku to see' (Taku TANAKA), and many of the latter one have ears (round or half-round ornament) on the edge of the crown and the fin (decorative plate along the body side).
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。Earからクォーテションマークを削除しました。
sen.e: This is called a transition from 'dotaku to hear' to'dotaku to see' (Taku TANAKA), and many of the latter one have ears (round or half-round ornament) on the edge of the crown and the fin (decorative plate along the body side).

sen.j: また、すでに鳴らす事を放棄した設計であるにも関わらず、長期間「鳴らす」銅鐸の「延命」の工夫であるはずの内面突帯が増加（三重化）された物もある。
sen.e: However, some have an additional inside raised-area (three-line type), which can be considered as a device for prolonged use for "ringing" although they were not designed to ring a sound any more.
However, some have an additional inside raised-area (three-line type), which can be considered as a device for prolonged use for 'ringing' although they were not designed to ring a sound any more.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: However, some have an additional inside raised-area (three-line type), which can be considered as a device for prolonged use for 'ringing' although they were not designed to ring a sound any more.

sen.j: これは通常目に触れることのない内面にまで装飾の手が伸びた例と言えるだろう。
sen.e: This is probably an example that a decoration was extended to the inner surface, which was usually out of sight.
This is probably an example that a decoration was extended to the inner surface, which was usually out of sight.
This is probably an example that a decoration was extended to the inner surface, which was usually out of sight.

sen.j: 埋納状況については村を外れた丘陵の麓、或いは頂上の少し下からの出土が大部分であり、深さ数十センチメートルの比較的浅い穴を掘って横たえた物が多い（逆さまに埋められた物も二例ある）。
sen.e: In most cases, dotaku were excavated at a foot of a hill or a bit lower area than the top of it outside of a village and found laid down sideways in a relatively shallow hole with several tens of centimeters in depth. (There are two cases of upside down burying.)

In most cases, dotaku were excavated at a foot of a hill or a bit lower area than the top of it outside of a village and found laid down sideways in a relatively shallow hole with several tens of centimeters in depth. (There are two cases of upside down burying.)

In most cases, dotaku were excavated at a foot of a hill or a bit lower area than the top of it outside of a village and found laid down sideways in a relatively shallow hole with several tens of centimeters in depth (there are two cases of upside down burying).
sen.cmt: 句読点を修正しました。

sen.j: 一、二個出土する場合が多いが、十数個同時に出土した例も五、六ある。
sen.e: Excavation of 1 or 2 dotaku from one site was common but there are five or six cases that 10 or more were concurrently found.
Excavation of 1 or 2 dotaku from one site was common but there are five or six cases that 10 or more were concurrently found.
Excavation of 1 or 2 dotaku from one site was common but there are five or six cases that 10 or more were concurrently found.

sen.j: あまり注目される事が無いが頂上からの出土が無いことは銅鐸の用途や信仰的位置を考える上で重要と考えられる。
sen.e: No excavation from the top of the hill is probably an important clue to revealing the purpose of dotaku and their religious status although this fact gets less attention.
No excavation from the top of the hill is probably an important clue to revealing the purpose of dotaku and their religious status although this fact gets less attention.
No excavation from the top of the hill is probably an important clue to revealing the purpose of dotaku and their religious status although this fact gets less attention.

sen.j: 土器や石器と違い、住居跡からの出土はほとんど無く、また銅剣や銅矛など他の銅製品と異なり、墓からの副葬品としての出土例は一度もないため（弥生時代の墓制墳丘墓の周濠部からの出土は一例ある）、個人の持ち物ではなく、村落共同体全体の所有物であったとされている。
sen.e: Also, unlike earthwares and stone tools, few dotaku were excavated from dwelling sites and, unlike other copper items such as doken (bronze swords) and dohoko (bronze pikes), no dotaku used as burial goods in tombs were discovered (One example exists of excavation at a groove surrounding the grave mound in the Yayoi period.), which indicates that dotaku were not private belongings but property of village communities.
sen.cmt: 銅剣・銅矛: dotakuのように"doken" (bronze swords), "dohoko" (bronze pikes)と音訳を残します。
sen.e: Also, unlike earthwares and stone tools, few dotaku were excavated from dwelling sites and, unlike other copper items such as doken (bronze swords) and dohoko (bronze pikes), no dotaku used as burial goods in tombs were discovered (One example exists of excavation at a groove surrounding the grave mound in the Yayoi period.), which indicates that dotaku were not private belongings but property of village communities.

Also, unlike earthwares and stone tools, few dotaku were excavated from dwelling sites and, unlike other copper items such as doken (bronze swords) and dohoko (bronze pikes), no dotaku used as burial goods in tombs were discovered (One example exists of excavation at a groove surrounding the grave mound in the Yayoi period.), which indicates that dotaku were not private belongings but property of village communities.

sen.j: なお、埋納時期は紀元前後と2世紀頃に集中している。
sen.e: And burial of dotaku took place intensively around the beginning of the first century and in the second century.
And burial of dotaku took place intensively around the beginning of the first century and in the second century.
And burial of dotaku took place intensively around the beginning of the first century and in the second century.

sen.j: 銅鐸を埋納したことの理由については以下のように諸説ある。
sen.e: There are various theories about the reasons for the burial as below.
There are various theories about the reasons for the burial as below.
There are various theories about the reasons for the burial as below.

sen.j: 米や穀物の豊穣を祈って拝んだのではないかと言う説。
sen.e: The first theory is to pray for good harvests of rice or other grains.
sen.cmt: 「…という説」: 以下、"first theory is../second theory is.."という風に表現していきます。
sen.e: The first theory is to pray for good harvests of rice or other grains.
The first theory is to pray for good harvests of rice or other grains.

sen.j: しかし、これには反論があり「祭るための宝物ならそれなりの扱いを受けるはずで、そのような施しは見受けられない」ということである。
sen.e: But a counterargument says that if they were treasures for ritual purposes, they must have been treated in such a way but no marks indicating this are found.
But a counterargument says that if they were treasures for ritual purposes, they must have been treated in such a way but no marks indicating this are found.
But a counterargument says that if they were treasures for ritual purposes, they must have been treated in such a way but no marks indicating this are found.

sen.j: だが、この場合の「施し」というものが具体的にどのような痕跡を指すのかが問題である。
sen.e: The question is, however, what the "marks" specifically refer to.
The question is, however, what the 'marks' specifically refer to.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: The question is, however, what the 'marks' specifically refer to.

sen.j: 平時は地中に埋納し、祭儀等の必要な時に掘り出して使用したが、祭儀方式や信仰の変化により使われなくなり、やがて埋納されたまま忘れ去られたとする説（松本清張等）。
sen.e: The second theory says that they were normally buried and, on a ceremonial occasion, dug out and used, but later, less often used due to changes in the ceremonial or religious style, they were left for all in the ground (Seicho MATSUMOTO and others).

The second theory says that they were normally buried and, on a ceremonial occasion, dug out and used, but later, less often used due to changes in the ceremonial or religious style, they were left for all in the ground (Seicho MATSUMOTO and others).

The second theory says that they were normally buried and, on a ceremonial occasion, dug out and used, but later, less often used due to changes in the ceremonial or religious style, they were left for all in the ground (Seicho MATSUMOTO and others).

sen.j: 特に「聞く銅鐸」の紋様の不鮮明さは埋納時から発掘までの土中での経年劣化ではなく、磨く等の行為によるものとされており（佐原真）、祭りの度に繰り返し掘り出し磨かれたためという。
sen.e: Especially, unclearness of the patterns on the "dotaku to hear," which is thought to have been created due to a treatment such as polishing, not due to degradation over time in the ground from a burial through to an excavation, possibly shows that they were repeatedly dug out and polished every time a ceremony was held (Makoto SAHARA).

Especially, unclearness of the patterns on the 'dotaku to hear,' which is thought to have been created due to a treatment such as polishing, not due to degradation over time in the ground from a burial through to an excavation, possibly shows that they were repeatedly dug out and polished every time a ceremony was held (Makoto SAHARA).
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: Especially, unclearness of the patterns on the 'dotaku to hear,' which is thought to have been created due to a treatment such as polishing, not due to degradation over time in the ground from a burial through to an excavation, possibly shows that they were repeatedly dug out and polished every time a ceremony was held (Makoto SAHARA).

sen.j: かつての東南アジア方面（ベトナム等、しかし現在は不明）の銅鼓も日ごろ地中に埋めてあり、祭りの時や葬儀の時取り出して使用していたという。
sen.e: It is said that in previous times in the southern east Asia area (Vietnam and others, but unknown now), bronze drums were usually buried and, picked up and used in the case of ceremonies and funerals.

It is said that in previous times in the southern east Asia area (Vietnam and others, but unknown now), bronze drums were usually buried and, picked up and used in the case of ceremonies and funerals.

It is said that in previous times in the southern east Asia area (Vietnam and others, but unknown now), bronze drums were usually buried and, picked up and used in the case of ceremonies and funerals.

sen.j: 大変事にあたり神に奉納したのではないかという説。
sen.e: The third theory is that they were dedicated to the god when a great happening occurred.
The third theory is that they were dedicated to the god when a great happening occurred.
The third theory is that they were dedicated to the god when a great happening occurred.

sen.j: しかし十数個同時に出土する例は「大変事」の規模にあわせたために大量に埋納したのか、全国各地で出土するのは全国規模で弥生時代を通して「大変事」が頻発したのか、等を埋納状況などを踏まえた上で考える必要がある。
sen.e: However, the states of a burial need to be still considered: whether the case of discovering over ten dotaku from one site shows such many were buried in accordance with the scale of the "great happening," or whether the case of the concurrent burials all over the country show the "great happening" occurred on a nationwide scale during the Yayoi period.

However, the states of a burial need to be still considered: whether the case of discovering over ten dotaku from one site shows such many were buried in accordance with the scale of the 'great happening,' or whether the case of the concurrent burials all over the country show the 'great happening' occurred on a nationwide scale during the Yayoi period.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: However, the states of a burial need to be still considered: whether the case of discovering over ten dotaku from one site shows such many were buried in accordance with the scale of the 'great happening,' or whether the case of the concurrent burials all over the country show the 'great happening' occurred on a nationwide scale during the Yayoi period.

sen.j: 地霊を鎮めるために銅器を埋納した風習という説。
sen.e: The fourth theory is that the bronze wares were customarily buried to appease ground spirits.
The fourth theory is that the bronze wares were customarily buried to appease ground spirits.
The fourth theory is that the bronze wares were customarily buried to appease ground spirits.

sen.j: 古代華南にそのような風習が見られた。
sen.e: Such custom was seen in the ancient South China.
Such custom was seen in the ancient South China.
Such custom was seen in the ancient South China.

sen.j: 文字の未だ定まっていない時代に、任命書に代えて鏡ではなく銅鐸を授与したという説。
sen.e: The fifth is that dotaku were used as an appointment letter instead of mirrors in the times when characters were not established yet.
sen.cmt: 「授与」: ここでは意味を広く取り、「使用」とします。
sen.e: The fifth is that dotaku were used as an appointment letter instead of mirrors in the times when characters were not established yet.
The fifth is that dotaku were used as an appointment letter instead of mirrors in the times when characters were not established yet.

sen.j: だが、そもそも鏡を任命書として与えるような権力者、集団が当時日本列島に存在したかがまず問題である。
sen.e: However, it is doubtful in the first place whether such a powerful person or group as gave a mirror for an appointment letter existed in the Japanese islands at that time. (In the Kofun period, there appeared to be not a few cases where alliance groups were given mirrors.)

However, it is doubtful in the first place whether such a powerful person or group as gave a mirror for an appointment letter existed in the Japanese islands at that time. (In the Kofun period, there appeared to be not a few cases where alliance groups were given mirrors.)
However, it is doubtful in the first place whether such a powerful person or group as gave a mirror for an appointment letter existed in the Japanese islands at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: （古墳時代には同盟集団に配布したと思しき例が少なからずあるようである。）
sen.e: (In the Kofun period, there appeared to be not a few cases where alliance groups were given mirrors.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: また、銅鐸の製造集団の負う文化的背景に由来すると思われる地域的な銅鐸の特徴差について考慮を全く欠いているという批判がある。
sen.e: Also, another critic says that this theory completely lacks a consideration regarding regional differences in the characteristics of dotaku, which probably deprived from differences of the cultural background each local producing group had.

Also, another critic says that this theory completely lacks a consideration regarding regional differences in the characteristics of dotaku, which probably deprived from differences of the cultural background each local producing group had.

Also, another critic says that this theory completely lacks a consideration regarding regional differences in the characteristics of dotaku, which probably deprived from differences of the cultural background each local producing group had.

sen.j: 銅鐸を祭る当時の列島の信仰的背景とは著しく異なる文化を持った外敵が攻めて来た等の社会的な変動が起きた時に、銅鐸の所有者が土中に隠匿して退散したという説（古田武彦等）。
sen.e: The sixth is that people hid dotaku in the ground and escaped when a social change took place, such as attacks of a foreign enemy with a significantly different religious background from that of the Japanese island of that time, when dotaku were adored (Takehiko FURUTA).

The sixth is that people hid dotaku in the ground and escaped when a social change took place, such as attacks of a foreign enemy with a significantly different religious background from that of the Japanese island of that time, when dotaku were adored (Takehiko FURUTA).

The sixth is that people hid dotaku in the ground and escaped when a social change took place, such as attacks of a foreign enemy with a significantly different religious background from that of the Japanese island of that time, when dotaku were adored (Takehiko FURUTA).

sen.j: この「外敵」を後世の有力集団の祖先に擬する説もある。
sen.e: One theory additionally says that this "foreign enemy" was possibly a descendant of the powerful group that later appeared in Japan.
One theory additionally says that this 'foreign enemy' was possibly a descendant of the powerful group that later appeared in Japan.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: One theory additionally says that this 'foreign enemy' was possibly a descendant of the powerful group that later appeared in Japan.

sen.j: しかし、全国的に似たような埋納のされ方なので、慌てて隠したのであればいろいろな埋め方があるはず、という反論がある。
sen.e: However, a counterargument says that if they had hid them in a hurry, various ways of burying would be found but the ways are similar all over the country.
However, a counterargument says that if they had hid them in a hurry, various ways of burying would be found but the ways are similar all over the country.
However, a counterargument says that if they had hid them in a hurry, various ways of burying would be found but the ways are similar all over the country.

sen.j: また、その外敵が銅鐸祭祀を否定する集団で、支配下に置いた地域の住民に銅鐸祭祀を放棄させたと考えれば、銅鐸が壊れた状態で出土することや、三世紀に急速に銅鐸祭祀が廃れたこと、銅鐸の用途が全く伝わっていないことなどに説明が付くという説もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is a theory that the hypothesis that the foreign enemy denied worship of dotaku and forced its local subordinates to abandon dotaku can explain the facts: that some dotaku were found broken, that worship of dotaku rapidly declined in the third century, and that the purpose have not been passed down at all.

On the other hand, there is a theory that the hypothesis that the foreign enemy denied worship of dotaku and forced its local subordinates to abandon dotaku can explain the facts: that some dotaku were found broken, that worship of dotaku rapidly declined in the third century, and that the purpose have not been passed down at all.

On the other hand, there is a theory that the hypothesis that the foreign enemy denied worship of dotaku and forced its local subordinates to abandon dotaku can explain the facts: that some dotaku were found broken, that worship of dotaku rapidly declined in the third century, and that the purpose have not been passed down at all.

sen.j: 政治的な社会変動により、不要なものとして（多数の場合は一括して）埋納したという説（三品影映・小林行雄等）。
sen.e: The seventh theory says that dotaku were disposed of (in a lump if many existed) in the ground because they were not necessary any more due to political social changes. (三品影映, Yukio KOBAYASHI and others)
sen.cmt: 三品影映: 読み方不明（おそらくKageharu MISHINAですが、確証できるものが見つかりませんでした。）
sen.e: The seventh theory says that dotaku were disposed of (in a lump if many existed) in the ground because they were not necessary any more due to political social changes. (三品影映, Yukio KOBAYASHI and others)

The seventh theory says that dotaku were disposed of (in a lump if many existed) in the ground because they were not necessary any more due to political social changes (Kageharu MISHINA, Yukio KOBAYASHI and others).
sen.cmt: 三品影映: 読み方不明ですが日本語で残すよりはよいかと思いました。

sen.j: つまり、弥生時代の個々の村落を統合する新しい支配者が現れる等して人々がより大きな集団を構成する際に、それまでのそれぞれの共同体の祭儀から専制的権力者の祭儀への変化が起き、各々の村落で使われていた銅鐸を埋納したというものである。
sen.e: It means that when larger groups of people were organized by a new ruler that integrated individual villages of the Yayoi period, changes occurred in the ceremonial style from one of each community to one of a man with absolute power, leading to burial of dotaku that had been used in each village.

It means that when larger groups of people were organized by a new ruler that integrated individual villages of the Yayoi period, changes occurred in the ceremonial style from one of each community to one of a man with absolute power, leading to burial of dotaku that had been used in each village.

It means that when larger groups of people were organized by a new ruler that integrated individual villages of the Yayoi period, changes occurred in the ceremonial style from one of each community to one of a man with absolute power, leading to burial of dotaku that had been used in each village.

sen.j: その際、集落によっては銅鐸を壊す等の行為もあったと思われ、一部の破壊銅鐸の出土はこのような理由によるとする。
sen.e: In that case, it is thought that dotaku were broken in some villages, which can be the reason for excavations of broken dotaku.
In that case, it is thought that dotaku were broken in some villages, which can be the reason for excavations of broken dotaku.
In that case, it is thought that dotaku were broken in some villages, which can be the reason for excavations of broken dotaku.

sen.j: また、この社会・祭儀の変化とは次の古墳時代への変化のことと関連付けられる事が多い。
sen.e: Also, the social and ceremonial changes here are often associated with a change to the next Kofun period.
Also, the social and ceremonial changes here are often associated with a change to the next Kofun period.
Also, the social and ceremonial changes here are often associated with a change to the next Kofun period.

sen.j: しかし、遺跡ごとに用途・保管方法や埋納の事情は異なっていたと考えられるため、すべての銅鐸を一律に論じる事は危険である。
sen.e: However, it is dangerous to discuss all dotaku in a single uniform way because the purpose, the storage method and conditions of burial probably varied depending on the sites.
However, it is dangerous to discuss all dotaku in a single uniform way because the purpose, the storage method and conditions of burial probably varied depending on the sites.
However, it is dangerous to discuss all dotaku in a single uniform way because the purpose, the storage method and conditions of burial probably varied depending on the sites.

sen.j: 弥生時代初期とされる青銅器の鉛同位体を測定すると、殷（商）・周（西周）時代の青銅器と鉛同位体の比率などがほぼ一致しており、この鉛は他の地域時代にて青銅器として見られることがないため、中国大陸や朝鮮半島から流入した青銅器等を鋳直して作成されたとする説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that dotaku were made by recasting bronze wares imported from mainland China and the Korean Peninsula because a measurement of lead isotope ratio shows nearly same values between bronze wares presumably made in the early Yayoi period and those produced in the Yin (Shang) dynasty and Zhou (Western Zhou) dynasty and also because no bronze wares composed of such lead are seen in other areas or eras.
sen.cmt: 殷（商）・周（西周）: すべてアルクの表記にならいました。
sen.e: There is a theory that dotaku were made by recasting bronze wares imported from mainland China and the Korean Peninsula because a measurement of lead isotope ratio shows nearly same values between bronze wares presumably made in the early Yayoi period and those produced in the Yin (Shang) dynasty and Zhou (Western Zhou) dynasty and also because no bronze wares composed of such lead are seen in other areas or eras.

There is a theory that dotaku were made by recasting bronze wares imported from mainland China and the Korean Peninsula because a measurement of lead isotope ratio shows nearly same values between bronze wares presumably made in the early Yayoi period and those produced in the Yin (Shang) dynasty and Zhou (Western Zhou) dynasty and also because no bronze wares composed of such lead are seen in other areas or eras.

sen.j: なお、日本での銅の史料上の記述は和銅元年（708年）が初見。
sen.e: In Japan, a historical record of copper first appeared in 708 (the first year of Wado, meaning "Japanese copper").
sen.cmt: 「和銅」: 文脈より、意味の補足を付けました。
sen.e: In Japan, a historical record of copper first appeared in 708 (the first year of Wado, meaning "Japanese copper").
In Japan, a historical record of copper first appeared in 708 (the first year of Wado, meaning "Japanese copper").

tit.j: 銅鐸文化圏と銅矛文化圏
tit.e: Dotaku cultural area and dohoko cultural area
Dotaku cultural area and dohoko cultural area
Dotaku cultural area and dohoko cultural area

sen.j: かつては遺跡が発掘される事自体が少なく、青銅器の出土量も少なかったため、銅矛は主に北九州周辺、銅鐸は近畿から東海地方にかけての地域で出土するという偏りがあった。
sen.e: Because ruins were less often excavated and neither were bronze wares before, there used to a biased distribution where dohoko were found mainly around northern Kyushu while dotaku were discovered in the area between Kinki and Tokai region.

Because ruins were less often excavated and neither were bronze wares before, there used to a biased distribution where dohoko were found mainly around northern Kyushu while dotaku were discovered in the area between Kinki and Tokai region.

Because ruins were less often excavated and neither were bronze wares before, there used to a biased distribution where dohoko were found mainly around northern Kyushu while dotaku were discovered in the area between Kinki and Tokai region.

sen.j: そしてこの偏りが絶対であったうちは中京以西の列島を二分する「銅鐸文化圏」と「銅矛文化圏」の存在によるものであると捉えられ、仮定としてではなく真剣に論じられていた時代があった。
sen.e: When this biased distribution was still predominant, the theory that the island from Chukyo to the west was divided into two parts, "the dotaku cultural area" and "the dohoko cultural area," was not treated as a hypothesis and seriously discussed.

When this biased distribution was still predominant, the theory that the island from Chukyo to the west was divided into two parts, 'the dotaku cultural area' and 'the dohoko cultural area,' was not treated as a hypothesis and seriously discussed.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: When this biased distribution was still predominant, the theory that the island from Chukyo to the west was divided into two parts, 'the dotaku cultural area' and 'the dohoko cultural area,' was not treated as a hypothesis and seriously discussed.

sen.j: （さらに中国地方を「銅剣文化圏」としてこれを加え、三つの文化圏が対立しあっていたとする説もあった。）
sen.e: (There was even a theory that three cultural areas confronted, including Chugoku region as "the doken cultural area.")
(There was even a theory that three cultural areas confronted, including Chugoku region as 'the doken cultural area.')
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、文中のダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテションに変更しました。
sen.e: (There was even a theory that three cultural areas confronted, including Chugoku region as 'the doken cultural area.')

sen.j: しかし、発掘される遺跡の増加に伴い当然のことながら青銅器の出土例も増え、「銅鐸文化圏」の地域で銅矛や銅剣が、「銅矛文化圏」内で銅鐸が出土するといったこと（特に有名な例が吉野ヶ里での出土）が多くなり、この仮説は成り立たなくなり次第に論じられる事は少なくなった。
sen.e: However, the more cases of excavation of bronze wares there were naturally along with increased excavations of ruins, the more situations where dohoko and doken were found in the dotaku cultural area and where dotaku were discovered in the dohoko cultural area (well-known example: the Yoshinogari Ruins) there were, which proved the hypothesis was not true as it was less and less often discussed.

However, the more cases of excavation of bronze wares there were naturally along with increased excavations of ruins, the more situations where dohoko and doken were found in 'the dotaku cultural area' and where dotaku were discovered in 'the dohoko cultural area' (well-known example: the Yoshinogari Ruins) there were, which proved the hypothesis was not true as it was less and less often discussed.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテションマークをつけました。
sen.e: However, the more cases of excavation of bronze wares there were naturally along with increased excavations of ruins, the more situations where dohoko and doken were found in 'the dotaku cultural area' and where dotaku were discovered in 'the dohoko cultural area' (well-known example: the Yoshinogari Ruins) there were, which proved the hypothesis was not true as it was less and less often discussed.

sen.j: しかし、現在でもこれらの出土分布の大勢に変わりはない。
sen.e: However, a rough distribution of these wares has not been changed.
However, a rough distribution of these wares has not been changed.
However, a rough distribution of these wares has not been changed.

sen.j: 桜ヶ丘出土銅鐸銅戈群
sen.e: Dotaku and doka (bronze dagger-axe) of Sakuragaoka
sen.cmt: 銅戈: dotakuのように"doka" (bronze dagger-axe)と音訳を残します。
sen.e: Dotaku and doka (bronze dagger-axe) of Sakuragaoka
Dotaku and doka (bronze dagger-axe) of Sakuragaoka

sen.j: - 国宝、神戸市灘区出土、神戸市立博物館所蔵
sen.e: National Treasure, excavated in Nada Ward, Kobe City, possessed by Kobe City Museum
sen.cmt: このセクションの博物館・資料館名は、基本的にtermsの訳とします。Termsにない場合はHPにある訳を参考とします。
sen.e: National Treasure, excavated in Nada Ward, Kobe City, possessed by the Kobe City Museum
sen.cmt: Kobe City Museumにtheをつけました。
sen.e: National Treasure, excavated in Nada Ward, Kobe City, possessed by the Kobe City Museum

sen.j: - ‐袈裟襷文（けさだすきもん）銅鐸11口、流水文銅鐸3口を含む一括資料。
sen.e: Batches of materials including 11 Buddhist stole-like pattern dotaku and 3 running water-like pattern dotaku
Batches of materials including 11 Buddhist stole-like pattern dotaku and 3 running water-like pattern dotaku
Batches of materials including 11 Buddhist stole-like pattern dotaku and 3 running water-like pattern dotaku

sen.j: 14口の銅鐸のうち、特に4号銅鐸と5号銅鐸は人物、動物などの略画が鋳出されたもので、資料的に貴重である。
sen.e: Among 14 dotaku, No. 4 and 5, on which sketches of men and animals were cast, are especially valuable materials.
Among 14 dotaku, No. 4 and 5, on which sketches of men and animals were cast, are especially valuable materials.
Among 14 dotaku, No. 4 and 5, on which sketches of men and animals were cast, are especially valuable materials.

sen.j: 袈裟襷文銅鐸

National Treasure, allegedly excavated in Kagawa Prefecture, possessed by the Tokyo National Museum

sen.e: National Treasure, allegedly excavated in Kagawa Prefecture, possessed by the Tokyo National Museum

sen.j: - ‐桜ヶ丘出土銅鐸と類似した略画が鋳出された銅鐸。
sen.e: Similar sketches to those on Sakuragaoka dotaku were cast on this dotaku.
Similar sketches to those on Sakuragaoka dotaku were cast on this dotaku.

sen.j: 荒神谷遺跡出土品

sen.j: - 国宝、島根県簸川郡斐川町出土、文化庁所蔵（島根県立古代出雲歴史博物館ほか保管）

sen.j: - ‐尾根の斜面から銅剣358本、銅矛（どうほこ）16本、銅鐸6口が出土した。
sen.e: 358 doken, 16 dohoko and 6 dotaku were excavated from a roof slope.
358 doken, 16 dohoko and 6 dotaku were excavated from a roof slope.
358 doken, 16 dohoko and 6 dotaku were excavated from a roof slope.

sen.j: 畿内を中心に出土する銅鐸、北九州を中心に出土する銅矛、出雲地方特有の形式をもつ銅剣が同一遺跡から、しかも大量に出土したという点で学術的価値が高い。
sen.e: They are academically valued in that dotaku mainly excavated in Kinai region, dohoko mainly excavated in northern Kyushu, and doken with a style unique to Izumo district were discovered in one site and also in large numbers.

They are academically valued in that dotaku mainly excavated in Kinai region, dohoko mainly excavated in northern Kyushu, and doken with a style unique to Izumo district were discovered in one site and also in large numbers.

They are academically valued in that dotaku mainly excavated in Kinai region, dohoko mainly excavated in northern Kyushu, and doken with a style unique to Izumo district were discovered in one site and also in large numbers.

sen.j: 日本式最古の銅鐸とされる。
sen.e: The dotaku are considered as the Japanese style's oldest dotaku.
The dotaku are considered as the Japanese style's oldest dotaku.
The dotaku are considered as the Japanese style's oldest dotaku.

sen.j: - 重要文化財、滋賀県立安土城考古博物館、東京国立博物館、辰馬考古資料館、野洲市立歴史民俗資料館（銅鐸博物館）ほか所蔵

sen.cmt: 野洲市立歴史民俗資料館: HPなしのため、音訳+意訳のかたちとします。
